Work

Today

I currently work as a backend Software Engineer at Yelp where I solve problems and build things around understanding places, locations and geocoding.

Once upon a time

During the summer of 2014 I interned at Rackspace in Atlanta, working on and around Openstack. Grad school was preceded by a stint as Systems Software Engineer in the healthcare division of Siemens in Bangalore. I did some fun work around electronic control of diesel engines in the summer of 2011 as an intern in the Automotive division of Mahindra & Mahindra.

Dabble

Writing

I write occasionally (less frequently these days than I would care to admit) at SeePha. This started off many years ago on blogger as an arbit collection of personal posts and at the most chuckle-inducing rants but seems to have grown older and wiser over the years into a longer form comprising quite a few travelogues. Travelling has been a deeply personal and favourite pastime.

The other side to storytelling comes in the form of photography, another evolving and satisfying hobby.

Design, Products and Engineering

For a while, it was a case of merely having strong opinions about the above. Perhaps it was the creative itch, but I decided to do something about it by tinkering about with some good old HTML, CSS and JS (the last time I properly did any of those was in the Windows 98 era). This site is one such experiment. Moving my blogger blog to a github-pages hosted, jekyll-based one is another.
